missing_entity.title: Missing entity in {name}
missing_entity.description: The entity `{entity}` configured in zone {name} is unavailable or missing. Please check configuration or the sensor.

data_migrated.title: Migration completed for {name}
data_migrated.description: Historical data from v1 was converted. Precision may be reduced initially. Use 'Analyze History' button to rebuild from recorder data for better accuracy.

weather_setup_failed.title: Weather Entity Unavailable
weather_setup_failed.description: The configured weather entity `{weather_entity}` for zone `{zone_name}` is not responding or does not exist. Please check your configuration.

duration_limit_exceeded.title: Max Heating Duration Exceeded in {name}
duration_limit_exceeded.description: The calculated required preheat duration is **{predicted} hours**, which exceeds your configured limit of **{limit} hours**. Please increase the 'Max Preheat Duration' in the integration options to ensure the target temperature is reached.

missing_schedule_entity.title: Missing Schedule for Optimal Stop
missing_schedule_entity.description: Optimal Stop is enabled for zone {name} (ID: {entry_id}), but no Schedule Entity is configured. The feature will not work correctly. Please reconfigure the integration and select a valid Schedule entity, or disable Optimal Stop.

physics_partial_reset.title: Thermal Model Partially Recalibrated (v2.7.1)
physics_partial_reset.description:
The physics engine was updated in v2.7.1 for improved stability. Your heating history ({samples} sessions) was preserved, but insulation data was reset to profile defaults. The system will re-learn outdoor influences over the next 5-10 heating cycles.

No action required. [Learn more]({learn_more_url})

forecast_stale.title: Forecast Data Stale (>2h)
forecast_stale.description:
The weather forecast cache has not updated for over 2 hours. The simulation is using outdated data.

**Common Causes:**
- Weather provider API limit reached.
- Internet connectivity issues.

weather_quality.title: Low Quality Forecast Data ({type})
weather_quality.description: The weather integration does not provide hourly forecasts. The system is falling back to '{type}' data, which is interpolated. This reduces the precision of the physics simulation. Please be aware that preheating times might be less accurate.

valve_saturation.title: Valve Saturated (>95% for 3h)
valve_saturation.description:
The valve has been open >95% for over 3 hours. The room is struggling to reach temperature.

**Possible Causes:**
- Window open (heat escaping).
- Radiator undersized or flow temperature too low.
- Sensor miscalibration.

physics_limit_mass_min.title: Thermal Mass at Minimum (1.0)
physics_limit_mass_min.description:
The thermal mass model has hit the minimum limit (1.0). This means the room temperature consistently rises faster than physically expected.

**Possible Causes:**
- Temperature sensor is too close to the heat source (measuring local heat, not room).
- Room is extremely small or extremely well insulated.
- 'Default Mass' profile setting is too low.

**Current Value:** {current}

physics_limit_mass_max.title: Thermal Mass at Maximum
physics_limit_mass_max.description:
The thermal mass model has hit the maximum limit. The room heats much slower than expected.

**Possible Causes:**
- Valve is not opening fully (broken or stuck).
- Temperature sensor is buried or insulated.
- Heating power is insufficient for the room size.

**Current Value:** {current}

physics_limit_loss_max.title: Thermal Loss Very High
physics_limit_loss_max.description:
The model detects extremely high heat loss. The room cools down very rapidly or struggles to hold heat.

**Possible Causes:**
- Window permanentely open or drafty.
- Outdoor temperature sensor is reporting values much warmer than reality (hiding the true delta).
- Insulation is extremely poor.

**Current Value:** {current}

zombie_schedule.title: Schedule has no events
zombie_schedule.description:
Optimal Stop is enabled, but the configured Schedule entity has no upcoming events (next_event is missing).

**Impact:** The system cannot determine when you will leave, so 'Optimal Stop' will never active.

**Fix:** Add events to your Schedule Helper or switch to using Input Datetime entities.

stale_sensor.title: Temperature Sensor Stale
stale_sensor.description:
The configured Room Temperature sensor has not updated for over 6 hours or is unavailable.

**Impact:** Preheat cannot function without current temperature data.

**Fix:** Check battery, Zigbee link, or entity naming.

weather_no_forecast.title: Weather Entity has no Forecast
weather_no_forecast.description:
Advanced Physics (Euler) is enabled, but the configured Weather entity does not provide forecast data (attribute `forecast` is empty/missing).

**Impact:** Simulation accuracy is degraded to standard mode (constant outdoor temp).

**Fix:** Configure a Weather integration that supports hourly forecasts (e.g. PirateWeather, Met.no).

adv_no_weather.title: Advanced Mode requires Weather Entity
adv_no_weather.description:
You have enabled 'Advanced Physics (Euler)', but no Weather Entity is configured.

**Fix:** Please configure a Weather entity in the integration options, or switch back to 'Standard' physics.

forecast_short.title: Forecast Horizon too Short
forecast_short.description:
The weather forecast ends sooner than your 'Max Coast Duration'. The simulation cannot look far enough into the future.

**Fix:** Reduce 'Max Coast Duration' or use a weather provider with longer hourly forecasts (48h+).

occupancy_stale.title: Occupancy Sensor Stuck
occupancy_stale.description:
The occupancy sensor has not changed state for over 14 days.

**Impact:** If this is unintentional, the system cannot learn your daily arrival patterns correctly.

**Fix:** Verify the sensor is working and mapped correctly.

hold_stuck.title: Preheat Held > 24h
hold_stuck.description:
The 'Preheat Logic Hold' switch has been ON for over 24 hours. The system is effectively disabled.

**Fix:** Turn off the 'Preheat Hold' switch if you want the system to resume automatic operation.

inhibit_stuck.title: External Inhibit / Window Open > 24h
inhibit_stuck.description:
The system is inhibited by an external sensor (Window Contact or Inhibit Switch) for over 24 hours.

**Fix:** Check your window sensors or the External Inhibit entity.

learning_stalled.title: Thermal Learning Stalled
learning_stalled.description:
The thermal model has not collected any new samples in over 7 days, despite the system being active.

**Possible Causes:**
- Temperature difference (Delta T) is too small (< 0.5K) during heating.
- Valve is not reporting position (if configured).
- System is not actually heating when requested.

sensor_unit_mismatch.title: Sensor Unit Mismatch
sensor_unit_mismatch.description:
The configured temperature sensor does not appear to be a Celsius temperature entity (Unit is not '°C' or Device Class is wrong).

**Fix:** Please review the sensor selection in the integration options.

sanity_temp.title: Implausible Temperature Readings
sanity_temp.description:
The temperature readings seem unrealistic. Either the Indoor Temperature is extreme (< -10°C / > 45°C), or it tracks the Outdoor Temperature exactly (Swapped Sensors?).

**Fix:** Please verify that Indoor and Outdoor sensors are assigned correctly.

no_outdoor_source.title: No Outdoor Temperature Source
no_outdoor_source.description:
Neither a dedicated Outdoor Sensor nor a Weather Entity is configured.

**Impact:** The physics model cannot account for insulation loss, severely degrading accuracy.

coast_capped.title: Optimal Stop Frequently Capped
coast_capped.description:
In the last 10 sessions, 'Optimal Stop' was frequently limited by the 'Max Coast Duration' setting.

**Recommendation:** Consider increasing 'Max Coast Duration' to allow for earlier stops and more savings.

max_coast_high.title: Max Coast High for Radiators
max_coast_high.description:
A 'Max Coast Duration' of > 3 hours is configured for a system that appears to be Radiator-based (Fast Response).

**Risk:** The room may cool down too much before you leave. Recommended: 1.0 - 2.0 hours for radiators.

tolerance_sanity.title: Stop Tolerance Unusual
tolerance_sanity.description:
The 'Stop Tolerance' is configured to an unusual value (< 0.1K or > 1.5K).

**Risk:**
- Too low: System may cycle on/off (flapping).
- Too high: Comfort may drop significantly before session end.
